text: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
author: John Muir

text: The earth has music for those who listen.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Nature is not a place to visit. It is home.
author: Gary Snyder

text: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
author: John Muir

text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

text: In nature, nothing is perfect and everything is perfect. Trees can be contorted, bent in weird ways, and they’re still beautiful.
author: Alice Walker

text: Nature is not our enemy, to be raped and conquered. Nature is ourselves, to be cherished and explored.
author: Terence McKenna

text: In all things of nature, there is something of the marvelous.
author: Aristotle

text: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

text: The earth laughs in flowers.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: One touch of nature makes the whole world kin.
author: William Shakespeare

text: The poetry of the earth is never dead.
author: John Keats

text: The mountains are calling, and I must go.
author: John Muir

text: Nature is the art of God.
author: Dante Alighieri

text: The silence of nature is very real. It surrounds you, you can feel it.
author: Ted Trueblood

text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.

text: The best things in life are the people we love, the places we’ve been, and the memories we’ve made along the way.
author: Unknown

text: The beauty of the natural world lies in the details.
author: Natalie Angier

text: The forest makes your heart gentle. You become one with it... No place for greed or anger there.
author: Pha Pachak

text: Choose only one master—nature.
author: Rembrandt

text: The richness I achieve comes from Nature, the source of my inspiration.
author: Claude Monet

text: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
author: Bertrand Russell

author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: The world is mud-luscious and puddle-wonderful.

text: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.

text: A lake carries you into recesses of feeling otherwise impenetrable.

text: Keep close to Nature's heart... and break clear away, once in awhile, and climb a mountain or spend a week in the woods. Wash your spirit clean.

text: In the presence of nature, a wild delight runs through the man, in spite of real sorrows.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: There is something infinitely healing in the repeated refrains of nature - the assurance that dawn comes after night, and spring after winter.
author: Rachel Carson

text: The poetry of earth is never dead.

text: Not just beautiful, though—the stars are like the trees in the forest, alive and breathing. And they’re watching me.
